title: Providing for the Closing of Executive Departments and Agencies of the Federal Government on December 24, 2025, and December 26, 2025
summary: Executive Order 14371, issued on December 18, 2025, mandates the closure of all executive departments and agencies of the Federal Government on Wednesday, December 24, 2025, and Friday, December 26, 2025. Employees will be excused from duty on these days, which fall before and after Christmas Day. However, agency heads may designate certain offices and employees to remain on duty for reasons of national security, defense, or other public needs. The order also clarifies that these days will be treated as holidays for the purpose of employee pay and leave, consistent with existing statutes and Executive Order 11582. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management is tasked with implementing the order, which is subject to applicable law and appropriations, and does not create new legal rights or benefits.
